intro: Conioselinum gmelinii, commonly known as the Siberian wormwood, is a perennial herb native to the cold climates of Eastern Europe and Siberia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine environments. Conioselinum gmelinii is valued for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
